intro: Argythamnia savanillensis, commonly known as the Mexican tamarisk, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in dry environments. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Argythamnia savanillensis is adapted to thrive in poor soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
